title: Are books written in the early 20th century of any value to read today? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t really know what you mean by ‘value’. However one of my all time favourite books is The Riddle of the Sands by Erskine Childers which I found immensely entertaining and thought provoking. Published in 1903 it is an early example of a spy novel and gives a real insight into the life and politics of the time. Childers himself is a fascinating character and reading the novel inspired me to discover more about him and the political situation in Ireland, where he was executed in 1923. I won’t spoil the novel or the almost unbelievable story of Childer’s life and death, but highly recommend that if you have any curiosity, you follow in my footsteps.

Most definitely yes. Here are a few of my favourite from the first decade of the 20th century: Heart of Darkness by Joseph Conrad The Hound of the Baskervilles by Arthur Conan Doyle The Tale of Peter Rabbit by Beatrix Potter. The value of a good book does not diminish over time.
no., they are so old the print is sliding down the page and names get mixed in with other things and the plot goes backwards. read fresh new books.
Of course. If they are well written. One of favorites is Tarzan of the Apes which was written in 1912. There are hundreds of other books, while dated, are worth reading.
